newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Arbed repeats 1997 started well for steel.
newsitem.headline: Arbed repeats 1997 started well for steel.

text.p: The head of Luxembourg steel group Arbed reiterated on Friday 1997 had started well for the company and hoped the trend would continue.

"The first few months of 1997 indicate strengthening demand accompanied by an improvement in selected prices, such that the terms of sales contracts are clearly higher. If this trend continues, the results of Arbed in the next three quarters will benefit," Arbed chairman Joseph Kinsch told the company's annual shareholders meeting.
Arbed swung to a 1.21 billion franc group loss in 1996.
